content.content:
1â†’#!/usr/bin/env bash
     2â†’# Node management for Memory Graph
     3â†’# Node types: concept, file, pattern, lesson, decision, session
     4â†’
     5â†’set -euo pipefail
     6â†’
     7â†’GRAPH_DIR="${GRAPH_DIR:-$(dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}")/..}"
     8â†’GRAPH_FILE="${GRAPH_DIR}/data/graph.json"
     9â†’
    10â†’# Ensure graph file exists
    11â†’init_graph() {
    12â†’    mkdir -p "$(dirname "$GRAPH_FILE")"
    13â†’    if [[ ! -f "$GRAPH_FILE" ]]; then
    14â†’        echo '{"nodes":{},"edges":[]}' > "$GRAPH_FILE"
    15â†’    fi
    16â†’}
    17â†’
    18â†’# Generate a unique node ID
    19â†’generate_node_id() {
    20â†’    local name="$1"
    21â†’    local type="$2"
    22â†’    # Create deterministic ID from type and name for deduplication
    23â†’    echo "${type}-$(echo -n "${name}" | md5sum | cut -c1-8)"
    24â†’}
    25â†’
    26â†’# Valid node types
    27â†’VALID_NODE_TYPES=("concept" "file" "pattern" "lesson" "decision" "session" "project")
    28â†’
    29â†’validate_node_type() {
    30â†’    local type="$1"
    31â†’    for valid in "${VALID_NODE_TYPES[@]}"; do
    32â†’        if [[ "$type" == "$valid" ]]; then
    33â†’            return 0
    34â†’        fi
    35â†’    done
    36â†’    return 1
    37â†’}
    38â†’
    39â†’# Add a node to the graph
    40â†’# Usage: add_node <type> <name> [data_json]
    41â†’add_node() {
    42â†’    local type="$1"
    43â†’    local name="$2"
    44â†’    local data="${3:-"{}"}"
    45â†’
    46â†’    if ! validate_node_type "$type"; then
    47â†’        echo "Error: Invalid node type '$type'. Valid types: ${VALID_NODE_TYPES[*]}" >&2
    48â†’        return 1
    49â†’    fi
    50â†’
    51â†’    init_graph
    52â†’
    53â†’    local id
    54â†’    id=$(generate_node_id "$name" "$type")
    55â†’    local timestamp
    56â†’    timestamp=$(date -u +"%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%SZ")
    57â†’
    58â†’    # Check if node exists for merging
    59â†’    local existing
    60â†’    existing=$(jq -r --arg id "$id" '.nodes[$id] // empty' "$GRAPH_FILE")
    61â†’
    62â†’    if [[ -n "$existing" ]]; then
    63â†’        # Merge: update data and updated_at, preserve created_at
    64â†’        jq --arg id "$id" \
    65â†’           --arg name "$name" \
    66â†’           --argjson new_data "$data" \
    67â†’           --arg updated "$timestamp" \
    68â†’           '.nodes[$id].data = (.nodes[$id].data * $new_data) | .nodes[$id].name = $name | .nodes[$id].updated_at = $updated' \
    69â†’           "$GRAPH_FILE" > "${GRAPH_FILE}.tmp" && mv "${GRAPH_FILE}.tmp" "$GRAPH_FILE"
    70â†’
    71â†’        echo "Merged node: $id"
    72â†’    else
    73â†’        # Create new node
    74â†’        jq --arg id "$id" \
    75â†’           --arg name "$name" \
    76â†’           --arg type "$type" \
    77â†’           --argjson data "$data" \
    78â†’           --arg created "$timestamp" \
    79â†’           '.nodes[$id] = {type: $type, name: $name, data: $data, created_at: $created, updated_at: $created}' \
    80â†’           "$GRAPH_FILE" > "${GRAPH_FILE}.tmp" && mv "${GRAPH_FILE}.tmp" "$GRAPH_FILE"
    81â†’
    82â†’        echo "Created node: $id"
    83â†’    fi
    84â†’
    85â†’    echo "$id"
    86â†’}
    87â†’
    88â†’# Get a node by ID
    89â†’get_node() {
    90â†’    local id="$1"
    91â†’    init_graph
    92â†’    jq -r --arg id "$id" '.nodes[$id] // empty' "$GRAPH_FILE"
    93â†’}
    94â†’
    95â†’# Get a node by name and optional type
    96â†’find_node() {
    97â†’    local name="$1"
    98â†’    local type="${2:-}"
    99â†’
   100â†’    init_graph
   101â†’
   102â†’    if [[ -n "$type" ]]; then
   103â†’        jq -r --arg name "$name" --arg type "$type" \
   104â†’           'to_entries[] | select(.value.name == $name and .value.type == $type) | .key' \
   105â†’           <<< "$(jq '.nodes' "$GRAPH_FILE")"
   106â†’    else
   107â†’        jq -r --arg name "$name" \
   108â†’           'to_entries[] | select(.value.name == $name) | .key' \
   109â†’           <<< "$(jq '.nodes' "$GRAPH_FILE")"
   110â†’    fi
   111â†’}
   112â†’
   113â†’# Delete a node and its edges
   114â†’delete_node() {
   115â†’    local id="$1"
   116â†’    init_graph
   117â†’
   118â†’    # Remove node and all edges referencing it
   119â†’    jq --arg id "$id" \
   120â†’       'del(.nodes[$id]) | .edges = [.edges[] | select(.from != $id and .to != $id)]' \
   121â†’       "$GRAPH_FILE" > "${GRAPH_FILE}.tmp" && mv "${GRAPH_FILE}.tmp" "$GRAPH_FILE"
   122â†’
   123â†’    echo "Deleted node: $id"
   124â†’}
   125â†’
   126â†’# List all nodes, optionally filtered by type
   127â†’list_nodes() {
   128â†’    local type="${1:-}"
   129â†’    init_graph
   130â†’
   131â†’    if [[ -n "$type" ]]; then
   132â†’        jq -r --arg type "$type" \
   133â†’           '.nodes | to_entries[] | select(.value.type == $type) | "\(.key)\t\(.value.type)\t\(.value.name)"' \
   134â†’           "$GRAPH_FILE"
   135â†’    else
   136â†’        jq -r '.nodes | to_entries[] | "\(.key)\t\(.value.type)\t\(.value.name)"' "$GRAPH_FILE"
   137â†’    fi
   138â†’}
   139â†’
   140â†’# Update node data
   141â†’update_node() {
   142â†’    local id="$1"
   143â†’    local data="$2"
   144â†’
   145â†’    init_graph
   146â†’
   147â†’    local timestamp
   148â†’    timestamp=$(date -u +"%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%SZ")
   149â†’
   150â†’    jq --arg id "$id" \
   151â†’       --argjson data "$data" \
   152â†’       --arg updated "$timestamp" \
   153â†’       'if .nodes[$id] then .nodes[$id].data = (.nodes[$id].data * $data) | .nodes[$id].updated_at = $updated else . end' \
   154â†’       "$GRAPH_FILE" > "${GRAPH_FILE}.tmp" && mv "${GRAPH_FILE}.tmp" "$GRAPH_FILE"
   155â†’
   156â†’    echo "Updated node: $id"
   157â†’}
   158â†’
   159â†’# Get node count
   160â†’node_count() {
   161â†’    init_graph
   162â†’    jq '.nodes | length' "$GRAPH_FILE"
   163â†’}
   164â†’
   165â†’# Export for use in other scripts
   166â†’export -f init_graph generate_node_id validate_node_type add_node get_node find_node delete_node list_nodes update_node node_count
   167â†’

1â†’#!/usr/bin/env bash
     2â†’# Edge management for Memory Graph
     3â†’# Edge types: relates_to, learned_from, affects, supersedes, contradicts
     4â†’
     5â†’set -euo pipefail
     6â†’
     7â†’GRAPH_DIR="${GRAPH_DIR:-$(dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}")/..}"
     8â†’GRAPH_FILE="${GRAPH_DIR}/data/graph.json"
     9â†’
    10â†’# Source nodes.sh for init_graph
    11â†’source "$(dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}")/nodes.sh"
    12â†’
    13â†’# Valid edge types
    14â†’VALID_EDGE_TYPES=("relates_to" "learned_from" "affects" "supersedes" "contradicts" "contains" "references" "implements" "depends_on" "produces" "consumes")
    15â†’
    16â†’validate_edge_type() {
    17â†’    local type="$1"
    18â†’    for valid in "${VALID_EDGE_TYPES[@]}"; do
    19â†’        if [[ "$type" == "$valid" ]]; then
    20â†’            return 0
    21â†’        fi
    22â†’    done
    23â†’    return 1
    24â†’}
    25â†’
    26â†’# Add an edge between nodes
    27â†’# Usage: add_edge <from_id> <to_id> <relation> [weight] [bidirectional]
    28â†’add_edge() {
    29â†’    local from="$1"
    30â†’    local to="$2"
    31â†’    local relation="$3"
    32â†’    local weight="${4:-1.0}"
    33â†’    local bidirectional="${5:-false}"
    34â†’
    35â†’    if ! validate_edge_type "$relation"; then
    36â†’        echo "Error: Invalid edge type '$relation'. Valid types: ${VALID_EDGE_TYPES[*]}" >&2
    37â†’        return 1
    38â†’    fi
    39â†’
    40â†’    init_graph
    41â†’
    42â†’    # Verify nodes exist
    43â†’    local from_node to_node
    44â†’    from_node=$(jq -r --arg id "$from" '.nodes[$id] // empty' "$GRAPH_FILE")
    45â†’    to_node=$(jq -r --arg id "$to" '.nodes[$id] // empty' "$GRAPH_FILE")
    46â†’
    47â†’    if [[ -z "$from_node" ]]; then
    48â†’        echo "Error: Source node '$from' not found" >&2
    49â†’        return 1
    50â†’    fi
    51â†’
    52â†’    if [[ -z "$to_node" ]]; then
    53â†’        echo "Error: Target node '$to' not found" >&2
    54â†’        return 1
    55â†’    fi
    56â†’
    57â†’    local timestamp
    58â†’    timestamp=$(date -u +"%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%SZ")
    59â†’
    60â†’    # Check if edge already exists
    61â†’    local existing
    62â†’    existing=$(jq -r --arg from "$from" --arg to "$to" --arg rel "$relation" \
    63â†’        '.edges[] | select(.from == $from and .to == $to and .relation == $rel) | .from' \
    64â†’        "$GRAPH_FILE")
    65â†’
    66â†’    if [[ -n "$existing" ]]; then
    67â†’        # Update weight of existing edge
    68â†’        jq --arg from "$from" --arg to "$to" --arg rel "$relation" \
    69â†’           --argjson weight "$weight" --arg updated "$timestamp" \
    70â†’           '.edges = [.edges[] | if (.from == $from and .to == $to and .relation == $rel) then .weight = $weight | .updated_at = $updated else . end]' \
    71â†’           "$GRAPH_FILE" > "${GRAPH_FILE}.tmp" && mv "${GRAPH_FILE}.tmp" "$GRAPH_FILE"
    72â†’        echo "Updated edge: $from -> $to ($relation)"
    73â†’    else
    74â†’        # Add new edge
    75â†’        jq --arg from "$from" --arg to "$to" --arg rel "$relation" \
    76â†’           --argjson weight "$weight" --arg created "$timestamp" \
    77â†’           --argjson bidir "$bidirectional" \
    78â†’           '.edges += [{from: $from, to: $to, relation: $rel, weight: $weight, bidirectional: $bidir, created_at: $created}]' \
    79â†’           "$GRAPH_FILE" > "${GRAPH_FILE}.tmp" && mv "${GRAPH_FILE}.tmp" "$GRAPH_FILE"
    80â†’        echo "Created edge: $from -> $to ($relation)"
    81â†’    fi
    82â†’
    83â†’    # Add reverse edge if bidirectional
    84â†’    if [[ "$bidirectional" == "true" ]]; then
    85â†’        local reverse_existing
    86â†’        reverse_existing=$(jq -r --arg from "$to" --arg to "$from" --arg rel "$relation" \
    87â†’            '.edges[] | select(.from == $from and .to == $to and .relation == $rel) | .from' \
    88â†’            "$GRAPH_FILE")
    89â†’
    90â†’        if [[ -z "$reverse_existing" ]]; then
    91â†’            jq --arg from "$to" --arg to "$from" --arg rel "$relation" \
    92â†’               --argjson weight "$weight" --arg created "$timestamp" \
    93â†’               '.edges += [{from: $from, to: $to, relation: $rel, weight: $weight, bidirectional: true, created_at: $created}]' \
    94â†’               "$GRAPH_FILE" > "${GRAPH_FILE}.tmp" && mv "${GRAPH_FILE}.tmp" "$GRAPH_FILE"
    95â†’        fi
    96â†’    fi
    97â†’}
    98â†’
    99â†’# Remove an edge
   100â†’delete_edge() {
   101â†’    local from="$1"
   102â†’    local to="$2"
   103â†’    local relation="${3:-}"
   104â†’
   105â†’    init_graph
   106â†’
   107â†’    if [[ -n "$relation" ]]; then
   108â†’        jq --arg from "$from" --arg to "$to" --arg rel "$relation" \
   109â†’           '.edges = [.edges[] | select(.from != $from or .to != $to or .relation != $rel)]' \
   110â†’           "$GRAPH_FILE" > "${GRAPH_FILE}.tmp" && mv "${GRAPH_FILE}.tmp" "$GRAPH_FILE"
   111â†’    else
   112â†’        jq --arg from "$from" --arg to "$to" \
   113â†’           '.edges = [.edges[] | select(.from != $from or .to != $to)]' \
   114â†’           "$GRAPH_FILE" > "${GRAPH_FILE}.tmp" && mv "${GRAPH_FILE}.tmp" "$GRAPH_FILE"
   115â†’    fi
   116â†’
   117â†’    echo "Deleted edge: $from -> $to"
   118â†’}
   119â†’
   120â†’# Get all edges from a node
   121â†’get_outgoing_edges() {
   122â†’    local from="$1"
   123â†’    init_graph
   124â†’    jq -r --arg from "$from" '.edges[] | select(.from == $from)' "$GRAPH_FILE"
   125â†’}
   126â†’
   127â†’# Get all edges to a node
   128â†’get_incoming_edges() {
   129â†’    local to="$1"
   130â†’    init_graph
   131â†’    jq -r --arg to "$to" '.edges[] | select(.to == $to)' "$GRAPH_FILE"
   132â†’}
   133â†’
   134â†’# Get all edges for a node (both directions)
   135â†’get_all_edges() {
   136â†’    local node="$1"
   137â†’    init_graph
   138â†’    jq -r --arg node "$node" '.edges[] | select(.from == $node or .to == $node)' "$GRAPH_FILE"
   139â†’}
   140â†’
   141â†’# List all edges
   142â†’list_edges() {
   143â†’    local relation="${1:-}"
   144â†’    init_graph
   145â†’
   146â†’    if [[ -n "$relation" ]]; then
   147â†’        jq -r --arg rel "$relation" \
   148â†’           '.edges[] | select(.relation == $rel) | "\(.from) -> \(.to) [\(.relation), weight: \(.weight)]"' \
   149â†’           "$GRAPH_FILE"
   150â†’    else
   151â†’        jq -r '.edges[] | "\(.from) -> \(.to) [\(.relation), weight: \(.weight)]"' "$GRAPH_FILE"
   152â†’    fi
   153â†’}
   154â†’
   155â†’# Update edge weight
   156â†’update_edge_weight() {
   157â†’    local from="$1"
   158â†’    local to="$2"
   159â†’    local relation="$3"
   160â†’    local new_weight="$4"
   161â†’
   162â†’    init_graph
   163â†’
   164â†’    local timestamp
   165â†’    timestamp=$(date -u +"%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%SZ")
   166â†’
   167â†’    jq --arg from "$from" --arg to "$to" --arg rel "$relation" \
   168â†’       --argjson weight "$new_weight" --arg updated "$timestamp" \
   169â†’       '.edges = [.edges[] | if (.from == $from and .to == $to and .relation == $rel) then .weight = $weight | .updated_at = $updated else . end]' \
   170â†’       "$GRAPH_FILE" > "${GRAPH_FILE}.tmp" && mv "${GRAPH_FILE}.tmp" "$GRAPH_FILE"
   171â†’
   172â†’    echo "Updated weight: $from -> $to ($relation) = $new_weight"
   173â†’}
   174â†’
   175â†’# Get edge count
   176â†’edge_count() {
   177â†’    init_graph
   178â†’    jq '.edges | length' "$GRAPH_FILE"
   179â†’}
   180â†’
   181â†’# Get neighbors of a node
   182â†’get_neighbors() {
   183â†’    local node="$1"
   184â†’    init_graph
   185â†’
   186â†’    # Get both outgoing and incoming neighbors
   187â†’    jq -r --arg node "$node" '
   188â†’        (.edges[] | select(.from == $node) | .to),
   189â†’        (.edges[] | select(.to == $node) | .from)
   190â†’    ' "$GRAPH_FILE" | sort -u
   191â†’}
   192â†’
   193â†’export -f validate_edge_type add_edge delete_edge get_outgoing_edges get_incoming_edges get_all_edges list_edges update_edge_weight edge_count get_neighbors
   194â†’

1â†’#!/usr/bin/env bash
     2â†’# Memory Graph - A searchable knowledge base for AI agents
     3â†’# Connects concepts, files, decisions, and learnings
     4â†’
     5â†’set -euo pipefail
     6â†’
     7â†’SCRIPT_DIR="$(cd "$(dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}")" && pwd)"
     8â†’export GRAPH_DIR="$SCRIPT_DIR"
     9â†’export GRAPH_FILE="${GRAPH_DIR}/data/graph.json"
    10â†’
    11â†’# Source library functions
    12â†’source "${SCRIPT_DIR}/lib/nodes.sh"
    13â†’source "${SCRIPT_DIR}/lib/edges.sh"
    14â†’source "${SCRIPT_DIR}/lib/search.sh"
    15â†’source "${SCRIPT_DIR}/lib/traverse.sh"
    16â†’source "${SCRIPT_DIR}/lib/lookup.sh"
    17â†’
    18â†’# Colors for output
    19â†’RED='\033[0;31m'
    20â†’GREEN='\033[0;32m'
    21â†’YELLOW='\033[0;33m'
    22â†’BLUE='\033[0;34m'
    23â†’CYAN='\033[0;36m'
    24â†’NC='\033[0m' # No Color
    25â†’
    26â†’# Print usage information
    27â†’usage() {
    28â†’    cat << EOF
    29â†’Memory Graph - Searchable knowledge base for AI agents
    30â†’
    31â†’USAGE:
    32â†’    graph.sh <command> [options]
    33â†’
    34â†’COMMANDS:
    35â†’    add <type> <name> [--data '{}']     Add a node to the graph
    36â†’    link <from> <to> --relation <type>  Create an edge between nodes
    37â†’    query <search>                       Full-text search across nodes
    38â†’    related <node> [--hops n]           Find related nodes
    39â†’    path <from> <to>                    Find connection path between nodes
    40â†’    visualize                           Output DOT format for graphviz
    41â†’
    42â†’    list [type]                         List all nodes (optionally by type)
    43â†’    get <node-id>                       Get details of a specific node
    44â†’    lookup <node-id>                    Reverse-lookup: find source entry for a graph node
    45â†’    delete <node-id>                    Delete a node and its edges
    46â†’
    47â†’    orphans                             Find nodes with no connections
    48â†’    hubs [limit]                        Find most connected nodes
    49â†’    clusters                            Find clusters of related nodes
    50â†’    stats                               Show graph statistics
    51â†’
    52â†’    import <file>                       Import nodes/edges from JSON
    53â†’    export [format]                     Export graph (json, dot, mermaid)
    54â†’
    55â†’NODE TYPES:
    56â†’    concept     Abstract ideas or topics
    57â†’    file        Source files or documents
    58â†’    pattern     Recurring patterns or practices
    59â†’    lesson      Learned insights
    60â†’    decision    Architectural or design decisions
    61â†’    session     Work sessions or sprints
    62â†’    project     Software projects in the ecosystem
    63â†’
    64â†’EDGE TYPES:
    65â†’    relates_to      General relationship
    66â†’    learned_from    Knowledge derived from
    67â†’    affects         Has impact on
    68â†’    supersedes      Replaces or updates
    69â†’    contradicts     Conflicts with
    70â†’    contains        Parent/child relationship
    71â†’    references      Points to
    72â†’    implements      Realizes or fulfills
    73â†’    depends_on      Requires
    74â†’    produces        Generates output consumed by another
    75â†’    consumes        Takes input produced by another
    76â†’
    77â†’EXAMPLES:
    78â†’    # Add a concept
    79â†’    graph.sh add concept "authentication" --data '{"tags": ["security", "core"]}'
    80â†’
    81â†’    # Link concepts
    82â†’    graph.sh link concept-abc123 file-def456 --relation "implements"
    83â†’
    84â†’    # Search for authentication-related knowledge
    85â†’    graph.sh query "authentication" --type concept
    86â†’
    87â†’    # Find what's related to a decision
    88â†’    graph.sh related decision-xyz --hops 3
    89â†’
    90â†’    # Reverse-lookup a decision node to its journal entry
    91â†’    graph.sh lookup decision-d7f00cf3
    92â†’
    93â†’    # Visualize the graph
    94â†’    graph.sh visualize | dot -Tpng -o graph.png
    95â†’
    96â†’EOF
    97â†’}
    98â†’
    99â†’# Add a node
   100â†’cmd_add() {
   101â†’    local type=""
   102â†’    local name=""
   103â†’    local data="{}"
   104â†’
   105â†’    # Parse arguments
   106â†’    while [[ $# -gt 0 ]]; do
   107â†’        case "$1" in
   108â†’            --data)
   109â†’                data="$2"
   110â†’                shift 2
   111â†’                ;;
   112â†’            *)
   113â†’                if [[ -z "$type" ]]; then
   114â†’                    type="$1"
   115â†’                elif [[ -z "$name" ]]; then
   116â†’                    name="$1"
   117â†’                fi
   118â†’                shift
   119â†’                ;;
   120â†’        esac
   121â†’    done
   122â†’
   123â†’    if [[ -z "$type" || -z "$name" ]]; then
   124â†’        echo -e "${RED}Error: Both type and name are required${NC}" >&2
   125â†’        echo "Usage: graph.sh add <type> <name> [--data '{}']"
   126â†’        return 1
   127â†’    fi
   128â†’
   129â†’    # Validate JSON data
   130â†’    if ! echo "$data" | jq . > /dev/null 2>&1; then
   131â†’        echo -e "${RED}Error: Invalid JSON data${NC}" >&2
   132â†’        return 1
   133â†’    fi
   134â†’
   135â†’    local result
   136â†’    result=$(add_node "$type" "$name" "$data")
   137â†’    local node_id
   138â†’    node_id=$(echo "$result" | tail -1)
   139â†’
   140â†’    echo -e "${GREEN}Node added:${NC} $node_id"
   141â†’    echo -e "  Type: $type"
   142â†’    echo -e "  Name: $name"
   143â†’}
   144â†’
   145â†’# Create a link/edge
   146â†’cmd_link() {
   147â†’    local from=""
   148â†’    local to=""
   149â†’    local relation=""
   150â†’    local weight="1.0"
   151â†’    local bidirectional="false"
   152â†’
   153â†’    # Parse arguments
   154â†’    while [[ $# -gt 0 ]]; do
   155â†’        case "$1" in
   156â†’            --relation)
   157â†’                relation="$2"
   158â†’                shift 2
   159â†’                ;;
   160â†’            --weight)
   161â†’                weight="$2"
   162â†’                shift 2
   163â†’                ;;
   164â†’            --bidirectional)
   165â†’                bidirectional="true"
   166â†’                shift
   167â†’                ;;
   168â†’            *)
   169â†’                if [[ -z "$from" ]]; then
   170â†’                    from="$1"
   171â†’                elif [[ -z "$to" ]]; then
   172â†’                    to="$1"
   173â†’                fi
   174â†’                shift
   175â†’                ;;
   176â†’        esac
   177â†’    done
   178â†’
   179â†’    if [[ -z "$from" || -z "$to" || -z "$relation" ]]; then
   180â†’        echo -e "${RED}Error: from, to, and --relation are required${NC}" >&2
   181â†’        echo "Usage: graph.sh link <from> <to> --relation <type>"
   182â†’        return 1
   183â†’    fi
   184â†’
   185â†’    add_edge "$from" "$to" "$relation" "$weight" "$bidirectional"
   186â†’    echo -e "${GREEN}Edge created:${NC} $from -> $to [$relation]"
   187â†’}
   188â†’
   189â†’# Search/query the graph
   190â†’cmd_query() {
   191â†’    if [[ $# -lt 1 ]]; then
   192â†’        echo -e "${RED}Error: Search query required${NC}" >&2
   193â†’        echo "Usage: graph.sh query <search> [--type type] [--fuzzy] [--limit n]"
   194â†’        return 1
   195â†’    fi
   196â†’
   197â†’    local results
   198â†’    results=$(search "$@")
   199â†’
   200â†’    if [[ -z "$results" ]]; then
   201â†’        echo -e "${YELLOW}No results found${NC}"
   202â†’        return 0
   203â†’    fi
   204â†’
   205â†’    echo -e "${CYAN}Search Results:${NC}"
   206â†’    echo "$results" | jq -r '"  \(.id) [\(.type)] \(.name) (score: \(.score))"'
   207â†’}
   208â†’
   209â†’# Find related nodes
   210â†’cmd_related() {
   211â†’    local node=""
   212â†’    local hops="2"
   213â†’
   214â†’    while [[ $# -gt 0 ]]; do
   215â†’        case "$1" in
   216â†’            --hops)
   217â†’                hops="$2"
   218â†’                shift 2
   219â†’                ;;
   220â†’            *)
   221â†’                node="$1"
   222â†’                shift
   223â†’                ;;
   224â†’        esac
   225â†’    done
   226â†’
   227â†’    if [[ -z "$node" ]]; then
   228â†’        echo -e "${RED}Error: Node ID required${NC}" >&2
   229â†’        echo "Usage: graph.sh related <node> [--hops n]"
   230â†’        return 1
   231â†’    fi
   232â†’
   233â†’    local results
   234â†’    results=$(find_related "$node" "$hops")
   235â†’
   236â†’    if [[ -z "$results" || "$results" == "[]" ]]; then
   237â†’        echo -e "${YELLOW}No related nodes found${NC}"
   238â†’        return 0
   239â†’    fi
   240â†’
   241â†’    echo -e "${CYAN}Related Nodes (within $hops hops):${NC}"
   242â†’    echo "$results" | jq -r '.[] | "  \(.hops) hop(s): \(.id) [\(.node.type)] \(.node.name)"'
   243â†’}
   244â†’
   245â†’# Find path between nodes
   246â†’cmd_path() {
   247â†’    if [[ $# -lt 2 ]]; then
   248â†’        echo -e "${RED}Error: Both from and to nodes required${NC}" >&2
   249â†’        echo "Usage: graph.sh path <from> <to>"
   250â†’        return 1
   251â†’    fi
   252â†’
   253â†’    local from="$1"
   254â†’    local to="$2"
   255â†’
   256â†’    local path
   257â†’    path=$(shortest_path "$from" "$to")
   258â†’
   259â†’    if [[ -z "$path" || "$path" == "[]" ]]; then
   260â†’        echo -e "${YELLOW}No path found between $from and $to${NC}"
   261â†’        return 0
   262â†’    fi
   263â†’
   264â†’    echo -e "${CYAN}Path from $from to $to:${NC}"
   265â†’
   266â†’    # Display path nodes
   267â†’    local path_length
   268â†’    path_length=$(echo "$path" | jq 'length')
   269â†’
   270â†’    echo "$path" | jq -r '
   271â†’        . as $nodes |
   272â†’        range(length) |
   273â†’        if . == 0 then "  \($nodes[.])"
   274â†’        else "  -> \($nodes[.])"
   275â†’        end
   276â†’    '
   277â†’}
   278â†’
   279â†’# Visualize graph in DOT format
   280â†’cmd_visualize() {
   281â†’    init_graph
   282â†’
   283â†’    echo "digraph MemoryGraph {"
   284â†’    echo "  rankdir=LR;"
   285â†’    echo "  node [shape=box, style=filled];"
   286â†’    echo ""
   287â†’
   288â†’    # Define node colors by type
   289â†’    echo "  // Node type colors"
   290â†’    echo "  node [fillcolor=\"#e3f2fd\"] // default"
   291â†’
   292â†’    # Output nodes with type-specific styling
   293â†’    jq -r '
   294â†’        .nodes | to_entries[] |
   295â†’        "  \"\(.key)\" [label=\"\(.value.name)\", tooltip=\"\(.value.type)\", fillcolor=\"" +
   296â†’        (if .value.type == "concept" then "#bbdefb"
   297â†’         elif .value.type == "file" then "#c8e6c9"
   298â†’         elif .value.type == "pattern" then "#fff9c4"
   299â†’         elif .value.type == "lesson" then "#f8bbd0"
   300â†’         elif .value.type == "decision" then "#d1c4e9"
   301â†’         elif .value.type == "session" then "#ffccbc"
   302â†’         elif .value.type == "project" then "#b2dfdb"
   303â†’         else "#e0e0e0" end) +
   304â†’        "\"];"
   305â†’    ' "$GRAPH_FILE"
   306â†’
   307â†’    echo ""
   308â†’
   309â†’    # Output edges
   310â†’    jq -r '
   311â†’        .edges[] |
   312â†’        "  \"\(.from)\" -> \"\(.to)\" [label=\"\(.relation)\", weight=\(.weight // 1)];"
   313â†’    ' "$GRAPH_FILE"
   314â†’
   315â†’    echo "}"
   316â†’}
   317â†’
   318â†’# List nodes
   319â†’cmd_list() {
   320â†’    local type="${1:-}"
   321â†’
   322â†’    local nodes
   323â†’    nodes=$(list_nodes "$type")
   324â†’
   325â†’    if [[ -z "$nodes" ]]; then
   326â†’        echo -e "${YELLOW}No nodes found${NC}"
   327â†’        return 0
   328â†’    fi
   329â†’
   330â†’    echo -e "${CYAN}Nodes:${NC}"
   331â†’    echo "$nodes" | while IFS=$'\t' read -r id type name; do
   332â†’        echo -e "  ${BLUE}$id${NC} [$type] $name"
   333â†’    done
   334â†’}
   335â†’
   336â†’# Get node details
   337â†’cmd_get() {
   338â†’    if [[ $# -lt 1 ]]; then
   339â†’        echo -e "${RED}Error: Node ID required${NC}" >&2
   340â†’        return 1
   341â†’    fi
   342â†’
   343â†’    local node
   344â†’    node=$(get_node "$1")
   345â†’
   346â†’    if [[ -z "$node" ]]; then
   347â†’        echo -e "${RED}Node not found: $1${NC}" >&2
   348â†’        return 1
   349â†’    fi
   350â†’
   351â†’    echo -e "${CYAN}Node: $1${NC}"
   352â†’    echo "$node" | jq .
   353â†’}
   354â†’
   355â†’# Reverse-lookup a graph node to its source entry
   356â†’cmd_lookup() {
   357â†’    local node_id=""
   358â†’    local json_flag=""
   359â†’
   360â†’    while [[ $# -gt 0 ]]; do
   361â†’        case "$1" in
   362â†’            --json)
   363â†’                json_flag="--json"
   364â†’                shift
   365â†’                ;;
   366â†’            *)
   367â†’                node_id="$1"
   368â†’                shift
   369â†’                ;;
   370â†’        esac
   371â†’    done
   372â†’
   373â†’    if [[ -z "$node_id" ]]; then
   374â†’        echo -e "${RED}Error: Node ID required${NC}" >&2
   375â†’        echo "Usage: graph.sh lookup <node-id> [--json]"
   376â†’        return 1
   377â†’    fi
   378â†’
   379â†’    local result
   380â†’    result=$(lookup_node "$node_id" "$json_flag")
   381â†’
   382â†’    if [[ -z "$result" ]]; then
   383â†’        echo -e "${RED}No source entry found for: $node_id${NC}" >&2
   384â†’        return 1
   385â†’    fi
   386â†’
   387â†’    echo -e "${CYAN}Lookup: $node_id${NC}"
   388â†’    echo "$result" | jq .
   389â†’}
   390â†’
   391â†’# Delete a node
   392â†’cmd_delete() {
   393â†’    if [[ $# -lt 1 ]]; then
   394â†’        echo -e "${RED}Error: Node ID required${NC}" >&2
   395â†’        return 1
   396â†’    fi
   397â†’
   398â†’    delete_node "$1"
   399â†’    echo -e "${GREEN}Deleted node: $1${NC}"
   400â†’}
   401â†’
   402â†’# Find orphaned nodes
   403â†’cmd_orphans() {
   404â†’    local orphans
   405â†’    orphans=$(find_orphans)
   406â†’
   407â†’    if [[ -z "$orphans" || "$orphans" == "[]" ]]; then
   408â†’        echo -e "${GREEN}No orphaned nodes found${NC}"
   409â†’        return 0
   410â†’    fi
   411â†’
   412â†’    echo -e "${YELLOW}Orphaned Nodes (no connections):${NC}"
   413â†’    echo "$orphans" | jq -r '.[] | "  \(.id) [\(.type)] \(.name)"'
   414â†’}
   415â†’
   416â†’# Find hub nodes
   417â†’cmd_hubs() {
   418â†’    local limit="${1:-10}"
   419â†’
   420â†’    local hubs
   421â†’    hubs=$(find_hubs "$limit")
   422â†’
   423â†’    if [[ -z "$hubs" || "$hubs" == "[]" ]]; then
   424â†’        echo -e "${YELLOW}No hub nodes found${NC}"
   425â†’        return 0
   426â†’    fi
   427â†’
   428â†’    echo -e "${CYAN}Most Connected Nodes:${NC}"
   429â†’    echo "$hubs" | jq -r '.[] | "  \(.id): \(.degree) connections [\(.type)] \(.name)"'
   430â†’}
   431â†’
   432â†’# Find clusters
   433â†’cmd_clusters() {
   434â†’    local clusters
   435â†’    clusters=$(find_clusters)
   436â†’
   437â†’    if [[ -z "$clusters" || "$clusters" == "[]" ]]; then
   438â†’        echo -e "${YELLOW}No clusters found${NC}"
   439â†’        return 0
   440â†’    fi
   441â†’
   442â†’    echo -e "${CYAN}Node Clusters:${NC}"
   443â†’    echo "$clusters" | jq -r 'to_entries[] | "  Cluster \(.key + 1): \(.value | length) nodes - \(.value | join(", "))"'
   444â†’}
   445â†’
   446â†’# Show graph statistics
   447â†’cmd_stats() {
   448â†’    init_graph
   449â†’
   450â†’    local node_count edge_count
   451â†’    node_count=$(jq '.nodes | length' "$GRAPH_FILE")
   452â†’    edge_count=$(jq '.edges | length' "$GRAPH_FILE")
   453â†’
   454â†’    echo -e "${CYAN}Graph Statistics:${NC}"
   455â†’    echo "  Nodes: $node_count"
   456â†’    echo "  Edges: $edge_count"
   457â†’    echo ""
   458â†’
   459â†’    echo "  Nodes by type:"
   460â†’    jq -r '.nodes | group_by(.type) | map({type: .[0].type, count: length}) | .[] | "    \(.type): \(.count)"' "$GRAPH_FILE" 2>/dev/null || \
   461â†’    jq -r '.nodes | to_entries | group_by(.value.type) | map({type: .[0].value.type, count: length}) | .[] | "    \(.type): \(.count)"' "$GRAPH_FILE"
   462â†’
   463â†’    echo ""
   464â†’    echo "  Edges by type:"
   465â†’    jq -r '.edges | group_by(.relation) | map({relation: .[0].relation, count: length}) | .[] | "    \(.relation): \(.count)"' "$GRAPH_FILE"
   466â†’
   467â†’    local orphan_count
   468â†’    orphan_count=$(find_orphans | jq 'length')
   469â†’    echo ""
   470â†’    echo "  Orphaned nodes: $orphan_count"
   471â†’}
   472â†’
   473â†’# Import from JSON file
   474â†’cmd_import() {
   475â†’    if [[ $# -lt 1 ]]; then
   476â†’        echo -e "${RED}Error: Import file required${NC}" >&2
   477â†’        return 1
   478â†’    fi
   479â†’
   480â†’    local import_file="$1"
   481â†’
   482â†’    if [[ ! -f "$import_file" ]]; then
   483â†’        echo -e "${RED}Error: File not found: $import_file${NC}" >&2
   484â†’        return 1
   485â†’    fi
   486â†’
   487â†’    # Validate JSON
   488â†’    if ! jq . "$import_file" > /dev/null 2>&1; then
   489â†’        echo -e "${RED}Error: Invalid JSON file${NC}" >&2
   490â†’        return 1
   491â†’    fi
   492â†’
   493â†’    init_graph
   494â†’
   495â†’    # Merge nodes and edges
   496â†’    jq -s '.[0] * .[1] | .nodes = (.[0].nodes + .[1].nodes) | .edges = (.[0].edges + .[1].edges)' \
   497â†’        "$GRAPH_FILE" "$import_file" > "${GRAPH_FILE}.tmp" && mv "${GRAPH_FILE}.tmp" "$GRAPH_FILE"
   498â†’
   499â†’    echo -e "${GREEN}Imported from: $import_file${NC}"
   500â†’    cmd_stats
   501â†’}
   502â†’
   503â†’# Export graph as JSON
   504â†’cmd_export() {
   505â†’    local format="${1:-json}"
   506â†’    init_graph
   507â†’
   508â†’    case "$format" in
   509â†’        json)
   510â†’            jq . "$GRAPH_FILE"
   511â†’            ;;
   512â†’        dot)
   513â†’            echo "digraph knowledge {"
   514â†’            echo "  rankdir=LR;"
   515â†’            jq -r '.nodes | to_entries[] | "  \"\(.key)\" [label=\"\(.value.name)\"];"' "$GRAPH_FILE"
   516â†’            jq -r '.edges[] | "  \"\(.from)\" -> \"\(.to)\" [label=\"\(.relation)\"];"' "$GRAPH_FILE"
   517â†’            echo "}"
   518â†’            ;;
   519â†’        mermaid)
   520â†’            echo "graph LR"
   521â†’            jq -r '.nodes | to_entries[] | "  \(.key)[\"\(.value.name)\"]"' "$GRAPH_FILE"
   522â†’            jq -r '.edges[] | "  \(.from) -->|\(.relation)| \(.to)"' "$GRAPH_FILE"
   523â†’            ;;
   524â†’        *)
   525â†’            echo "Unknown format: $format (use json, dot, or mermaid)" >&2
   526â†’            return 1
   527â†’            ;;
   528â†’    esac
   529â†’}
   530â†’
   531â†’# Main command dispatcher
   532â†’main() {
   533â†’    if [[ $# -lt 1 ]]; then
   534â†’        usage
   535â†’        exit 0
   536â†’    fi
   537â†’
   538â†’    local command="$1"
   539â†’    shift
   540â†’
   541â†’    case "$command" in
   542â†’        add)
   543â†’            cmd_add "$@"
   544â†’            ;;
   545â†’        link)
   546â†’            cmd_link "$@"
   547â†’            ;;
   548â†’        query|search)
   549â†’            cmd_query "$@"
   550â†’            ;;
   551â†’        related)
   552â†’            cmd_related "$@"
   553â†’            ;;
   554â†’        path)
   555â†’            cmd_path "$@"
   556â†’            ;;
   557â†’        visualize|viz)
   558â†’            cmd_visualize "$@"
   559â†’            ;;
   560â†’        list|ls)
   561â†’            cmd_list "$@"
   562â†’            ;;
   563â†’        get)
   564â†’            cmd_get "$@"
   565â†’            ;;
   566â†’        lookup)
   567â†’            cmd_lookup "$@"
   568â†’            ;;
   569â†’        delete|rm)
   570â†’            cmd_delete "$@"
   571â†’            ;;
   572â†’        orphans)
   573â†’            cmd_orphans "$@"
   574â†’            ;;
   575â†’        hubs)
   576â†’            cmd_hubs "$@"
   577â†’            ;;
   578â†’        clusters)
   579â†’            cmd_clusters "$@"
   580â†’            ;;
   581â†’        stats)
   582â†’            cmd_stats "$@"
   583â†’            ;;
   584â†’        import)
   585â†’            cmd_import "$@"
   586â†’            ;;
   587â†’        export)
   588â†’            cmd_export "$@"
   589â†’            ;;
   590â†’        help|--help|-h)
   591â†’            usage
   592â†’            ;;
   593â†’        *)
   594â†’            echo -e "${RED}Unknown command: $command${NC}" >&2
   595â†’            echo "Run 'graph.sh help' for usage information"
   596â†’            exit 1
   597â†’            ;;
   598â†’    esac
   599â†’}
   600â†’
   601â†’main "$@"
   602â†’

     2â†’# lineage.sh - Memory that compounds
     3â†’#
     4â†’# A system for AI agents to build persistent, searchable memory across sessions.
     5â†’
     6â†’set -euo pipefail
     7â†’
     8â†’LINEAGE_DIR="${LINEAGE_DIR:-$(cd "$(dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}")" && pwd)}"

    18â†’NC='\033[0m'
    19â†’
    20â†’show_help() {
    21â†’    echo "Lineage - Memory That Compounds"
    22â†’    echo ""
    23â†’    echo "Usage: lineage <component> <command> [options]"
    24â†’    echo ""
    25â†’    echo "Components:"

    27â†’    echo "  graph     Searchable knowledge graph of concepts and relationships"
    28â†’    echo "  patterns  Learned patterns and anti-patterns"
    29â†’    echo "  transfer  Session context and succession"
    30â†’    echo "  inbox     Raw observation staging area"
    31â†’    echo ""
    32â†’    echo "Quick Commands:"

    34â†’    echo "  lineage learn <pattern>     Quick pattern capture"
    35â†’    echo "  lineage handoff <message>   Create handoff for next session"
    36â†’    echo "  lineage resume [session]    Resume from previous session"
    37â†’    echo "  lineage search <query>      Search across all components"
    38â†’    echo "  lineage context <project>   Gather full context for a project"
    39â†’    echo "  lineage suggest <context>   Suggest relevant patterns"
    40â†’    echo "  lineage status              Show current session state"
    41â†’    echo "  lineage observe <text>     Capture a raw observation to inbox"
    42â†’    echo "  lineage inbox [--status S] List inbox observations"
    43â†’    echo "  lineage ingest <proj> <type> <file>  Bulk import from external formats"
    44â†’    echo ""
    45â†’    echo "Philosophy:"
    46â†’    echo "  - Decisions have rationale, not just outcomes"
    47â†’    echo "  - Patterns learned are never lost"
    48â†’    echo "  - Context transfers between sessions"

    50â†’}
    51â†’
    52â†’# Quick commands that span components
    53â†’cmd_remember() {

    56â†’

    60â†’
    61â†’cmd_handoff() {
    62â†’    "$LINEAGE_DIR/transfer/transfer.sh" handoff "$@"
    63â†’}
    64â†’
    65â†’cmd_resume() {
    66â†’    "$LINEAGE_DIR/transfer/transfer.sh" resume "$@"
    67â†’}
    68â†’
    69â†’cmd_search() {
    70â†’    local query="$1"

    72â†’    echo ""
    73â†’    
    74â†’    echo -e "${CYAN}Journal:${NC}"
    75â†’    "$LINEAGE_DIR/journal/journal.sh" query "$query" 2>/dev/null || echo "  (no results)"
    76â†’    echo ""
    77â†’    
    78â†’    echo -e "${CYAN}Graph:${NC}"
    79â†’    "$LINEAGE_DIR/graph/graph.sh" query "$query" 2>/dev/null || echo "  (no results)"
    80â†’    echo ""
    81â†’    
    82â†’    echo -e "${CYAN}Patterns:${NC}"
    83â†’    "$LINEAGE_DIR/patterns/patterns.sh" list 2>/dev/null | grep -i "$query" || echo "  (no results)"
    84â†’}
    85â†’
    86â†’cmd_status() {
    87â†’    "$LINEAGE_DIR/transfer/transfer.sh" status
    88â†’}
    89â†’
    90â†’cmd_suggest() {
    91â†’    "$LINEAGE_DIR/patterns/patterns.sh" suggest "$@"
    92â†’}

1â†’#!/usr/bin/env bash
     2â†’# Storage layer for decisions - JSONL-based with indexing
     3â†’
     4â†’set -euo pipefail
     5â†’
     6â†’SCRIPT_DIR="$(cd "$(dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}")" && pwd)"
     7â†’DATA_DIR="${SCRIPT_DIR}/../data"
     8â†’DECISIONS_FILE="${DATA_DIR}/decisions.jsonl"
     9â†’INDEX_DIR="${DATA_DIR}/index"
    10â†’
    11â†’# Portable line-reversal: tries tac, then tail -r, then awk fallback
    12â†’reverse_lines() {
    13â†’    if command -v tac >/dev/null 2>&1; then
    14â†’        tac "$@"
    15â†’    elif tail -r /dev/null 2>/dev/null; then
    16â†’        tail -r "$@"
    17â†’    else
    18â†’        awk '{a[NR]=$0} END {for(i=NR;i>=1;i--) print a[i]}' "$@"
    19â†’    fi
    20â†’}
    21â†’
    22â†’# Ensure data directories exist
    23â†’init_store() {
    24â†’    mkdir -p "$DATA_DIR" "$INDEX_DIR"
    25â†’    touch "$DECISIONS_FILE"
    26â†’}
    27â†’
    28â†’# Append a decision to the store
    29â†’store_decision() {
    30â†’    local decision_json="$1"
    31â†’    init_store
    32â†’
    33â†’    # Append to JSONL file
    34â†’    echo "$decision_json" >> "$DECISIONS_FILE"
    35â†’
    36â†’    # Update indexes
    37â†’    local id timestamp type
    38â†’    id=$(echo "$decision_json" | jq -r '.id')
    39â†’    timestamp=$(echo "$decision_json" | jq -r '.timestamp')
    40â†’    type=$(echo "$decision_json" | jq -r '.type // "other"')
    41â†’
    42â†’    # Date index (YYYY-MM-DD -> list of decision IDs)
    43â†’    local date_key
    44â†’    date_key=$(echo "$timestamp" | cut -d'T' -f1)
    45â†’    echo "$id" >> "${INDEX_DIR}/date_${date_key}.idx"
    46â†’
    47â†’    # Type index
    48â†’    echo "$id" >> "${INDEX_DIR}/type_${type}.idx"
    49â†’
    50â†’    # Entity index
    51â†’    local entity
    52â†’    while IFS= read -r entity; do
    53â†’        [[ -z "$entity" ]] && continue
    54â†’        local safe_entity
    55â†’        safe_entity=$(echo "$entity" | sed 's/[^a-zA-Z0-9._-]/_/g')
    56â†’        [[ -n "$safe_entity" ]] && echo "$id" >> "${INDEX_DIR}/entity_${safe_entity}.idx"
    57â†’    done < <(echo "$decision_json" | jq -r '.entities[]?' 2>/dev/null || true)
    58â†’
    59â†’    # Tag index
    60â†’    local tag
    61â†’    while IFS= read -r tag; do
    62â†’        [[ -z "$tag" ]] && continue
    63â†’        local safe_tag
    64â†’        safe_tag=$(echo "$tag" | sed 's/[^a-zA-Z0-9._-]/_/g')
    65â†’        [[ -n "$safe_tag" ]] && echo "$id" >> "${INDEX_DIR}/tag_${safe_tag}.idx"
    66â†’    done < <(echo "$decision_json" | jq -r '.tags[]?' 2>/dev/null || true)
    67â†’
    68â†’    echo "$id"
    69â†’}
    70â†’
    71â†’# Get a decision by ID
    72â†’get_decision() {
    73â†’    local id="$1"
    74â†’    # Parse JSONL and find matching record
    75â†’    jq -c --arg id "$id" 'select(.id == $id)' "$DECISIONS_FILE" 2>/dev/null | tail -1
    76â†’}
    77â†’
    78â†’# Update a decision (append new version, mark old as superseded)
    79â†’update_decision() {
    80â†’    local id="$1"
    81â†’    local field="$2"
    82â†’    local value="$3"
    83â†’
    84â†’    local current
    85â†’    current=$(get_decision "$id")
    86â†’
    87â†’    if [[ -z "$current" ]]; then
    88â†’        echo "Error: Decision $id not found" >&2
    89â†’        return 1
    90â†’    fi
    91â†’
    92â†’    # Create updated record (compact for JSONL)
    93â†’    local updated
    94â†’    if [[ "$value" =~ ^\[ ]] || [[ "$value" =~ ^\{ ]]; then
    95â†’        # JSON value
    96â†’        updated=$(echo "$current" | jq -c --argjson val "$value" ".$field = \$val")
    97â†’    else
    98â†’        # String value
    99â†’        updated=$(echo "$current" | jq -c --arg val "$value" ".$field = \$val")
   100â†’    fi
   101â†’
   102â†’    # Append updated version
   103â†’    echo "$updated" >> "$DECISIONS_FILE"
   104â†’}
   105â†’
   106â†’# List recent decisions
   107â†’list_recent() {
   108â†’    local count="${1:-10}"
   109â†’    init_store
   110â†’
   111â†’    # Get unique decisions (latest version of each)
   112â†’    reverse_lines "$DECISIONS_FILE" | \
   113â†’        jq -s 'group_by(.id) | map(.[-1])' | \
   114â†’        jq ".[0:$count]"
   115â†’}
   116â†’
   117â†’# List decisions by date range
   118â†’list_by_date() {
   119â†’    local start_date="$1"
   120â†’    local end_date="${2:-$start_date}"
   121â†’
   122â†’    jq -s --arg start "$start_date" --arg end "$end_date" '
   123â†’        [.[] | select(.timestamp >= $start and .timestamp <= ($end + "T23:59:59Z"))]
   124â†’        | group_by(.id) | map(.[-1])
   125â†’        | sort_by(.timestamp) | reverse
   126â†’    ' "$DECISIONS_FILE"
   127â†’}
   128â†’
   129â†’# Search decisions by text (full-text search)
   130â†’search_decisions() {
   131â†’    local query="$1"
   132â†’    local query_lower
   133â†’    query_lower=$(echo "$query" | tr '[:upper:]' '[:lower:]')
   134â†’
   135â†’    jq -s --arg q "$query_lower" '
   136â†’        [.[] | select(
   137â†’            (.decision | ascii_downcase | contains($q)) or
   138â†’            (.rationale // "" | ascii_downcase | contains($q)) or
   139â†’            (.lesson_learned // "" | ascii_downcase | contains($q)) or
   140â†’            (.alternatives | map(ascii_downcase) | any(contains($q))) or
   141â†’            (.entities | map(ascii_downcase) | any(contains($q))) or
   142â†’            (.tags | map(ascii_downcase) | any(contains($q)))
   143â†’        )]
   144â†’        | group_by(.id) | map(.[-1])
   145â†’        | sort_by(.timestamp) | reverse
   146â†’    ' "$DECISIONS_FILE"
   147â†’}
   148â†’
   149â†’# Get decisions by entity (file, function, concept)
   150â†’get_by_entity() {
   151â†’    local entity="$1"
   152â†’    local safe_entity
   153â†’    safe_entity=$(echo "$entity" | sed 's/[^a-zA-Z0-9._-]/_/g')
   154â†’
   155â†’    local index_file="${INDEX_DIR}/entity_${safe_entity}.idx"
   156â†’
   157â†’    if [[ -f "$index_file" ]]; then
   158â†’        local ids
   159â†’        ids=$(sort -u "$index_file" | paste -sd'|' -)
   160â†’        grep -E "\"id\":\"(${ids})\"" "$DECISIONS_FILE" | \
   161â†’            jq -s 'group_by(.id) | map(.[-1]) | sort_by(.timestamp) | reverse'
   162â†’    else
   163â†’        # Fallback to full search if no index
   164â†’        jq -s --arg e "$entity" '
   165â†’            [.[] | select(.entities | map(ascii_downcase) | any(contains($e | ascii_downcase)))]
   166â†’            | group_by(.id) | map(.[-1])
   167â†’            | sort_by(.timestamp) | reverse
   168â†’        ' "$DECISIONS_FILE"
   169â†’    fi
   170â†’}
   171â†’
   172â†’# Get decisions by type
   173â†’get_by_type() {
   174â†’    local type="$1"
   175â†’
   176â†’    jq -s --arg t "$type" '
   177â†’        [.[] | select(.type == $t)]
   178â†’        | group_by(.id) | map(.[-1])
   179â†’        | sort_by(.timestamp) | reverse
   180â†’    ' "$DECISIONS_FILE"
   181â†’}
   182â†’
   183â†’# Get decisions by tag
   184â†’get_by_tag() {
   185â†’    local tag="$1"
   186â†’
   187â†’    jq -s --arg t "$tag" '
   188â†’        [.[] | select(.tags | any(. == $t))]
   189â†’        | group_by(.id) | map(.[-1])
   190â†’        | sort_by(.timestamp) | reverse
   191â†’    ' "$DECISIONS_FILE"
   192â†’}
   193â†’
   194â†’# Get decisions by project (matches tag prefix "project:")
   195â†’get_by_project() {
   196â†’    local project="$1"
   197â†’
   198â†’    jq -s --arg p "$project" '
   199â†’        [.[] | select(.tags | any(. == $p or startswith($p + ":") or startswith($p + ",")))]
   200â†’        | group_by(.id) | map(.[-1])
   201â†’        | sort_by(.timestamp) | reverse
   202â†’    ' "$DECISIONS_FILE"
   203â†’}
   204â†’
   205â†’# Get decisions by outcome
   206â†’get_by_outcome() {
   207â†’    local outcome="$1"
   208â†’
   209â†’    jq -s --arg o "$outcome" '
   210â†’        [.[] | select(.outcome == $o)]
   211â†’        | group_by(.id) | map(.[-1])
   212â†’        | sort_by(.timestamp) | reverse
   213â†’    ' "$DECISIONS_FILE"
   214â†’}
   215â†’
   216â†’# Count decisions by various dimensions
   217â†’get_stats() {
   218â†’    jq -s '
   219â†’        group_by(.id) | map(.[-1]) |
   220â†’        {
   221â†’            total: length,
   222â†’            by_type: (group_by(.type) | map({key: .[0].type, value: length}) | from_entries),
   223â†’            by_outcome: (group_by(.outcome) | map({key: .[0].outcome, value: length}) | from_entries),
   224â†’            with_lessons: [.[] | select(.lesson_learned != null)] | length,
   225â†’            by_month: (group_by(.timestamp[0:7]) | map({key: .[0].timestamp[0:7], value: length}) | from_entries)
   226â†’        }
   227â†’    ' "$DECISIONS_FILE"
   228â†’}
   229â†’
   230â†’# Export decisions for a session
   231â†’export_session() {
   232â†’    local session_id="$1"
   233â†’
   234â†’    jq -s --arg s "$session_id" '
   235â†’        [.[] | select(.session_id == $s)]
   236â†’        | group_by(.id) | map(.[-1])
   237â†’        | sort_by(.timestamp)
   238â†’    ' "$DECISIONS_FILE"
   239â†’}
   240â†’
   241â†’# Compact the JSONL file (keep only latest version of each decision)
   242â†’compact_decisions() {
   243â†’    init_store
   244â†’
   245â†’    local temp_file
   246â†’    temp_file=$(mktemp)
   247â†’
   248â†’    # Keep only the last occurrence of each decision ID
   249â†’    jq -s 'group_by(.id) | map(.[-1]) | sort_by(.timestamp) | .[]' -c "$DECISIONS_FILE" > "$temp_file"
   250â†’
   251â†’    local before after
   252â†’    before=$(wc -l < "$DECISIONS_FILE" | tr -d ' ')
   253â†’    after=$(wc -l < "$temp_file" | tr -d ' ')
   254â†’
   255â†’    mv "$temp_file" "$DECISIONS_FILE"
   256â†’
   257â†’    echo "Compacted: $before -> $after records (removed $((before - after)) duplicates)"
   258â†’
   259â†’    # Rebuild indexes after compaction
   260â†’    rebuild_indexes
   261â†’}
   262â†’
   263â†’# Rebuild all indexes from scratch
   264â†’rebuild_indexes() {
   265â†’    rm -rf "$INDEX_DIR"
   266â†’    mkdir -p "$INDEX_DIR"
   267â†’
   268â†’    while IFS= read -r line; do
   269â†’        local id timestamp type
   270â†’        id=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.id')
   271â†’        timestamp=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.timestamp')
   272â†’        type=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.type // "other"')
   273â†’
   274â†’        # Date index
   275â†’        local date_key
   276â†’        date_key=$(echo "$timestamp" | cut -d'T' -f1)
   277â†’        echo "$id" >> "${INDEX_DIR}/date_${date_key}.idx"
   278â†’
   279â†’        # Type index
   280â†’        echo "$id" >> "${INDEX_DIR}/type_${type}.idx"
   281â†’
   282â†’        # Entity index
   283â†’        echo "$line" | jq -r '.entities[]?' | while read -r entity; do
   284â†’            local safe_entity
   285â†’            safe_entity=$(echo "$entity" | sed 's/[^a-zA-Z0-9._-]/_/g')
   286â†’            echo "$id" >> "${INDEX_DIR}/entity_${safe_entity}.idx"
   287â†’        done
   288â†’
   289â†’        # Tag index
   290â†’        echo "$line" | jq -r '.tags[]?' | while read -r tag; do
   291â†’            local safe_tag
   292â†’            safe_tag=$(echo "$tag" | sed 's/[^a-zA-Z0-9._-]/_/g')
   293â†’            echo "$id" >> "${INDEX_DIR}/tag_${safe_tag}.idx"
   294â†’        done
   295â†’    done < "$DECISIONS_FILE"
   296â†’
   297â†’    echo "Indexes rebuilt"
   298â†’}
   299â†’

1â†’#!/usr/bin/env bash
     2â†’# Decision capture library - parses and enriches decision data
     3â†’
     4â†’set -euo pipefail
     5â†’
     6â†’SCRIPT_DIR="$(cd "$(dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}")" && pwd)"
     7â†’
     8â†’# Generate unique decision ID
     9â†’generate_decision_id() {
    10â†’    echo "dec-$(od -An -tx1 -N4 /dev/urandom | tr -d ' \n')"
    11â†’}
    12â†’
    13â†’# Generate session ID if not set
    14â†’get_session_id() {
    15â†’    if [[ -n "${LINEAGE_SESSION_ID:-}" ]]; then
    16â†’        echo "$LINEAGE_SESSION_ID"
    17â†’    elif [[ -f "${SCRIPT_DIR}/../data/.current_session" ]]; then
    18â†’        cat "${SCRIPT_DIR}/../data/.current_session"
    19â†’    else
    20â†’        local session_id="session-$(od -An -tx1 -N4 /dev/urandom | tr -d ' \n')"
    21â†’        mkdir -p "${SCRIPT_DIR}/../data"
    22â†’        echo "$session_id" > "${SCRIPT_DIR}/../data/.current_session"
    23â†’        echo "$session_id"
    24â†’    fi
    25â†’}
    26â†’
    27â†’# Extract entities from decision text
    28â†’# Looks for file paths, function names, and quoted terms
    29â†’extract_entities() {
    30â†’    local text="$1"
    31â†’    local entities=()
    32â†’
    33â†’    # Extract file paths (e.g., src/main.rs, lib/utils.py)
    34â†’    while IFS= read -r match; do
    35â†’        [[ -n "$match" ]] && entities+=("$match")
    36â†’    done < <(echo "$text" | grep -oE '[a-zA-Z0-9_/-]+\.[a-zA-Z]{1,4}' 2>/dev/null | sort -u || true)
    37â†’
    38â†’    # Extract function/method names (e.g., parse_config(), handleEvent)
    39â†’    while IFS= read -r match; do
    40â†’        [[ -n "$match" ]] && entities+=("$match")
    41â†’    done < <(echo "$text" | grep -oE '[a-z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*\(\)' 2>/dev/null | sed 's/()$//' | sort -u || true)
    42â†’
    43â†’    # Extract backtick-quoted terms
    44â†’    while IFS= read -r match; do
    45â†’        [[ -n "$match" ]] && entities+=("$match")
    46â†’    done < <(echo "$text" | grep -oE '`[^`]+`' 2>/dev/null | sed 's/`//g' | sort -u || true)
    47â†’
    48â†’    # Output as JSON array (filter empty strings)
    49â†’    if [[ ${#entities[@]} -eq 0 ]]; then
    50â†’        echo "[]"
    51â†’    else
    52â†’        printf '%s\n' "${entities[@]}" | grep -v '^$' | jq -R . | jq -s '.'
    53â†’    fi
    54â†’}
    55â†’
    56â†’# Auto-detect decision type based on keywords
    57â†’detect_decision_type() {
    58â†’    local text="$1"
    59â†’    local lower_text
    60â†’    lower_text=$(echo "$text" | tr '[:upper:]' '[:lower:]')
    61â†’
    62â†’    # Architecture patterns
    63â†’    if echo "$lower_text" | grep -qE '(architecture|structure|design|pattern|layer|module|component|system)'; then
    64â†’        echo "architecture"
    65â†’        return
    66â†’    fi
    67â†’
    68â†’    # Tooling patterns
    69â†’    if echo "$lower_text" | grep -qE '(tool|library|dependency|package|framework|cli|command)'; then
    70â†’        echo "tooling"
    71â†’        return
    72â†’    fi
    73â†’
    74â†’    # Naming patterns
    75â†’    if echo "$lower_text" | grep -qE '(name|naming|rename|call|term|convention)'; then
    76â†’        echo "naming"
    77â†’        return
    78â†’    fi
    79â†’
    80â†’    # Bugfix patterns
    81â†’    if echo "$lower_text" | grep -qE '(fix|bug|issue|error|crash|broken|regression)'; then
    82â†’        echo "bugfix"
    83â†’        return
    84â†’    fi
    85â†’
    86â†’    # Refactor patterns
    87â†’    if echo "$lower_text" | grep -qE '(refactor|cleanup|simplify|extract|inline|reorganize)'; then
    88â†’        echo "refactor"
    89â†’        return
    90â†’    fi
    91â†’
    92â†’    # Process patterns
    93â†’    if echo "$lower_text" | grep -qE '(process|workflow|procedure|policy|guideline)'; then
    94â†’        echo "process"
    95â†’        return
    96â†’    fi
    97â†’
    98â†’    # Default to implementation
    99â†’    echo "implementation"
   100â†’}
   101â†’
   102â†’# Get current git commit if in a repo
   103â†’get_git_commit() {
   104â†’    if git rev-parse --git-dir >/dev/null 2>&1; then
   105â†’        git rev-parse HEAD 2>/dev/null || echo ""
   106â†’    else
   107â†’        echo ""
   108â†’    fi
   109â†’}
   110â†’
   111â†’# Create a full decision record
   112â†’create_decision_record() {
   113â†’    local decision="$1"
   114â†’    local rationale="${2:-}"
   115â†’    local alternatives="${3:-}"
   116â†’    local tags="${4:-}"
   117â†’    local explicit_type="${5:-}"
   118â†’
   119â†’    local id
   120â†’    id=$(generate_decision_id)
   121â†’
   122â†’    local timestamp
   123â†’    timestamp=$(date -u +"%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%SZ")
   124â†’
   125â†’    local session_id
   126â†’    session_id=$(get_session_id)
   127â†’
   128â†’    local entities
   129â†’    entities=$(extract_entities "$decision $rationale")
   130â†’
   131â†’    local decision_type
   132â†’    if [[ -n "$explicit_type" ]]; then
   133â†’        decision_type="$explicit_type"
   134â†’    else
   135â†’        decision_type=$(detect_decision_type "$decision $rationale")
   136â†’    fi
   137â†’
   138â†’    local git_commit
   139â†’    git_commit=$(get_git_commit)
   140â†’
   141â†’    # Parse alternatives into array
   142â†’    local alt_array="[]"
   143â†’    if [[ -n "$alternatives" ]]; then
   144â†’        alt_array=$(echo "$alternatives" | tr ',' '\n' | sed 's/^[[:space:]]*//;s/[[:space:]]*$//' | jq -R . | jq -s .)
   145â†’    fi
   146â†’
   147â†’    # Parse tags into array
   148â†’    local tags_array="[]"
   149â†’    if [[ -n "$tags" ]]; then
   150â†’        tags_array=$(echo "$tags" | tr ',' '\n' | sed 's/^[[:space:]]*//;s/[[:space:]]*$//' | jq -R . | jq -s .)
   151â†’    fi
   152â†’
   153â†’    # Build JSON record (compact for JSONL format)
   154â†’    jq -c -n \
   155â†’        --arg id "$id" \
   156â†’        --arg timestamp "$timestamp" \
   157â†’        --arg session_id "$session_id" \
   158â†’        --arg decision "$decision" \
   159â†’        --arg rationale "$rationale" \
   160â†’        --argjson alternatives "$alt_array" \
   161â†’        --arg outcome "pending" \
   162â†’        --arg type "$decision_type" \
   163â†’        --argjson entities "$entities" \
   164â†’        --argjson tags "$tags_array" \
   165â†’        --arg git_commit "$git_commit" \
   166â†’        '{
   167â†’            id: $id,
   168â†’            timestamp: $timestamp,
   169â†’            session_id: $session_id,
   170â†’            decision: $decision,
   171â†’            rationale: (if $rationale == "" then null else $rationale end),
   172â†’            alternatives: $alternatives,
   173â†’            outcome: $outcome,
   174â†’            type: $type,
   175â†’            entities: $entities,
   176â†’            tags: $tags,
   177â†’            lesson_learned: null,
   178â†’            related_decisions: [],
   179â†’            git_commit: (if $git_commit == "" then null else $git_commit end)
   180â†’        }'
   181â†’}
   182â†’
   183â†’# Parse decision text that may include inline rationale
   184â†’# Format: "decision text [because: rationale] [vs: alt1, alt2]"
   185â†’parse_inline_decision() {
   186â†’    local text="$1"
   187â†’
   188â†’    local decision rationale alternatives
   189â†’
   190â†’    # Extract rationale if present
   191â†’    if [[ "$text" =~ \[because:[[:space:]]*([^\]]+)\] ]]; then
   192â†’        rationale="${BASH_REMATCH[1]}"
   193â†’        text="${text/\[because: $rationale\]/}"
   194â†’        text="${text/\[because:$rationale\]/}"
   195â†’    else
   196â†’        rationale=""
   197â†’    fi
   198â†’
   199â†’    # Extract alternatives if present
   200â†’    if [[ "$text" =~ \[vs:[[:space:]]*([^\]]+)\] ]]; then
   201â†’        alternatives="${BASH_REMATCH[1]}"
   202â†’        text="${text/\[vs: $alternatives\]/}"
   203â†’        text="${text/\[vs:$alternatives\]/}"
   204â†’    else
   205â†’        alternatives=""
   206â†’    fi
   207â†’
   208â†’    # Clean up decision text
   209â†’    decision=$(echo "$text" | sed 's/^[[:space:]]*//;s/[[:space:]]*$//')
   210â†’
   211â†’    echo "$decision"
   212â†’    echo "$rationale"
   213â†’    echo "$alternatives"
   214â†’}
   215â†’

Find the code in ~/dev/lineage/ that ingests data into graph/data/graph.json. I need to understand:
1. Which file(s) handle graph node creation/updates
2. Where `updated_at` timestamps get set

content.content:
1â†’#!/usr/bin/env bash
     2â†’# Relationship building for decisions - links decisions to files and each other
     3â†’# Writes to the main knowledge graph (graph/data/graph.json) via the graph library.
     4â†’
     5â†’set -euo pipefail
     6â†’
     7â†’SCRIPT_DIR="$(cd "$(dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}")" && pwd)"
     8â†’source "${SCRIPT_DIR}/store.sh"
     9â†’
    10â†’# Source the main graph library
    11â†’_LINEAGE_ROOT="${SCRIPT_DIR}/../.."
    12â†’export GRAPH_DIR="${_LINEAGE_ROOT}/graph"
    13â†’export GRAPH_FILE="${GRAPH_DIR}/data/graph.json"
    14â†’# edges.sh sources nodes.sh internally
    15â†’source "${_LINEAGE_ROOT}/graph/lib/edges.sh"
    16â†’
    17â†’# Map journal relationship names to valid graph edge types
    18â†’_map_edge_type() {
    19â†’    local rel="$1"
    20â†’    case "$rel" in
    21â†’        related|shared_entity) echo "relates_to" ;;
    22â†’        supersedes)            echo "supersedes" ;;
    23â†’        contradicts)           echo "contradicts" ;;
    24â†’        depends_on)            echo "depends_on" ;;
    25â†’        *)                     echo "relates_to" ;;
    26â†’    esac
    27â†’}
    28â†’
    29â†’# Ensure a decision node exists in the main graph.
    30â†’# Uses the journal decision ID as the node name so lookups stay deterministic.
    31â†’# Returns the graph node ID on stdout.
    32â†’_ensure_decision_node() {
    33â†’    local decision_id="$1"
    34â†’
    35â†’    local decision_text=""
    36â†’    local dec_record
    37â†’    dec_record=$(get_decision "$decision_id" 2>/dev/null || true)
    38â†’    if [[ -n "$dec_record" ]]; then
    39â†’        decision_text=$(echo "$dec_record" | jq -r '.decision // ""')
    40â†’    fi
    41â†’
    42â†’    local node_data
    43â†’    node_data=$(jq -n --arg jid "$decision_id" --arg text "$decision_text" \
    44â†’        '{journal_id: $jid, decision: $text}')
    45â†’
    46â†’    # add_node prints "Created node: <id>" or "Merged node: <id>" then the id
    47â†’    local output
    48â†’    output=$(add_node "decision" "$decision_id" "$node_data" 2>/dev/null) || return 1
    49â†’    # The last line of output is the node ID
    50â†’    echo "$output" | tail -1
    51â†’}
    52â†’
    53â†’# Ensure a file node exists in the main graph. Returns the graph node ID.
    54â†’_ensure_file_node() {
    55â†’    local filepath="$1"
    56â†’
    57â†’    local basename
    58â†’    basename=$(basename "$filepath")
    59â†’    local ext="${basename##*.}"
    60â†’    local node_data
    61â†’    node_data=$(jq -n --arg path "$filepath" --arg ext "$ext" \
    62â†’        '{path: $path, language: $ext}')
    63â†’
    64â†’    local output
    65â†’    output=$(add_node "file" "$filepath" "$node_data" 2>/dev/null) || return 1
    66â†’    echo "$output" | tail -1
    67â†’}
    68â†’
    69â†’# Link a decision to specific files
    70â†’link_to_files() {
    71â†’    local decision_id="$1"
    72â†’    shift
    73â†’    local files=("$@")
    74â†’
    75â†’    local dec_node_id
    76â†’    dec_node_id=$(_ensure_decision_node "$decision_id") || true
    77â†’
    78â†’    if [[ -z "${dec_node_id:-}" ]]; then
    79â†’        return 1
    80â†’    fi
    81â†’
    82â†’    for file in "${files[@]}"; do
    83â†’        local normalized
    84â†’        normalized=$(realpath -m "$file" 2>/dev/null || echo "$file")
    85â†’
    86â†’        local file_node_id
    87â†’        file_node_id=$(_ensure_file_node "$normalized") || true
    88â†’
    89â†’        if [[ -n "${file_node_id:-}" ]]; then
    90â†’            add_edge "$dec_node_id" "$file_node_id" "references" 2>/dev/null || true
    91â†’        fi
    92â†’
    93â†’        # Keep decision entities in sync
    94â†’        update_decision "$decision_id" "entities" \
    95â†’            "$(get_decision "$decision_id" | jq --arg file "$normalized" '.entities + [$file] | unique')" \
    96â†’            2>/dev/null || true
    97â†’    done
    98â†’}
    99â†’
   100â†’# Link two decisions as related
   101â†’link_decisions() {
   102â†’    local decision_id1="$1"
   103â†’    local decision_id2="$2"
   104â†’    local relationship="${3:-related}"
   105â†’
   106â†’    local node_id1 node_id2
   107â†’    node_id1=$(_ensure_decision_node "$decision_id1") || true
   108â†’    node_id2=$(_ensure_decision_node "$decision_id2") || true
   109â†’
   110â†’    if [[ -n "${node_id1:-}" && -n "${node_id2:-}" ]]; then
   111â†’        local edge_type
   112â†’        edge_type=$(_map_edge_type "$relationship")
   113â†’        add_edge "$node_id1" "$node_id2" "$edge_type" "1.0" "true" 2>/dev/null || true
   114â†’    fi
   115â†’
   116â†’    # Update related_decisions in both journal records
   117â†’    local current1 current2
   118â†’    current1=$(get_decision "$decision_id1" 2>/dev/null || true)
   119â†’    current2=$(get_decision "$decision_id2" 2>/dev/null || true)
   120â†’
   121â†’    if [[ -n "$current1" ]]; then
   122â†’        update_decision "$decision_id1" "related_decisions" \
   123â†’            "$(echo "$current1" | jq --arg id "$decision_id2" '.related_decisions + [$id] | unique')" \
   124â†’            2>/dev/null || true
   125â†’    fi
   126â†’
   127â†’    if [[ -n "$current2" ]]; then
   128â†’        update_decision "$decision_id2" "related_decisions" \
   129â†’            "$(echo "$current2" | jq --arg id "$decision_id1" '.related_decisions + [$id] | unique')" \
   130â†’            2>/dev/null || true
   131â†’    fi
   132â†’}
   133â†’
   134â†’# Find decisions related to a file
   135â†’get_decisions_for_file() {
   136â†’    local file="$1"
   137â†’    local normalized
   138â†’    normalized=$(realpath -m "$file" 2>/dev/null || echo "$file")
   139â†’
   140â†’    # Look up the file node in the main graph
   141â†’    local file_node_id
   142â†’    file_node_id=$(generate_node_id "$normalized" "file")
   143â†’
   144â†’    local neighbor_ids
   145â†’    neighbor_ids=$(get_neighbors "$file_node_id" 2>/dev/null || true)
   146â†’
   147â†’    if [[ -n "$neighbor_ids" ]]; then
   148â†’        # Resolve neighbor decision nodes back to journal IDs
   149â†’        local decision_ids=()
   150â†’        while read -r nid; do
   151â†’            [[ -z "$nid" ]] && continue
   152â†’            local node_data
   153â†’            node_data=$(get_node "$nid" 2>/dev/null || true)
   154â†’            if [[ -n "$node_data" ]]; then
   155â†’                local ntype
   156â†’                ntype=$(echo "$node_data" | jq -r '.type // ""')
   157â†’                if [[ "$ntype" == "decision" ]]; then
   158â†’                    local journal_id
   159â†’                    journal_id=$(echo "$node_data" | jq -r '.data.journal_id // .name')
   160â†’                    [[ -n "$journal_id" ]] && decision_ids+=("$journal_id")
   161â†’                fi
   162â†’            fi
   163â†’        done <<< "$neighbor_ids"
   164â†’
   165â†’        if [[ ${#decision_ids[@]} -gt 0 ]]; then
   166â†’            local results=()
   167â†’            for did in "${decision_ids[@]}"; do
   168â†’                local dec
   169â†’                dec=$(get_decision "$did" 2>/dev/null || true)
   170â†’                [[ -n "$dec" ]] && results+=("$dec")
   171â†’            done
   172â†’            if [[ ${#results[@]} -gt 0 ]]; then
   173â†’                printf '%s\n' "${results[@]}" | jq -s 'unique_by(.id)'
   174â†’                return 0
   175â†’            fi
   176â†’        fi
   177â†’    fi
   178â†’
   179â†’    # Fall back to searching by entity in the journal store
   180â†’    get_by_entity "$normalized"
   181â†’}
   182â†’
   183â†’# Find related decisions (graph traversal)
   184â†’get_related_decisions() {
   185â†’    local decision_id="$1"
   186â†’    local depth="${2:-1}"
   187â†’
   188â†’    local decision
   189â†’    decision=$(get_decision "$decision_id" 2>/dev/null || true)
   190â†’
   191â†’    if [[ -z "$decision" ]]; then
   192â†’        echo "[]"
   193â†’        return
   194â†’    fi
   195â†’
   196â†’    # Look up decision node in the main graph and traverse
   197â†’    local dec_node_id
   198â†’    dec_node_id=$(generate_node_id "$decision_id" "decision")
   199â†’
   200â†’    local neighbor_ids
   201â†’    neighbor_ids=$(get_neighbors "$dec_node_id" 2>/dev/null || true)
   202â†’
   203â†’    if [[ -n "$neighbor_ids" ]]; then
   204â†’        local results=()
   205â†’        while read -r nid; do
   206â†’            [[ -z "$nid" ]] && continue
   207â†’            local node_data
   208â†’            node_data=$(get_node "$nid" 2>/dev/null || true)
   209â†’            if [[ -n "$node_data" ]]; then
   210â†’                local ntype
   211â†’                ntype=$(echo "$node_data" | jq -r '.type // ""')
   212â†’                if [[ "$ntype" == "decision" ]]; then
   213â†’                    local journal_id
   214â†’                    journal_id=$(echo "$node_data" | jq -r '.data.journal_id // .name')
   215â†’                    if [[ -n "$journal_id" && "$journal_id" != "$decision_id" ]]; then
   216â†’                        local dec
   217â†’                        dec=$(get_decision "$journal_id" 2>/dev/null || true)
   218â†’                        [[ -n "$dec" ]] && results+=("$dec")
   219â†’                    fi
   220â†’                fi
   221â†’            fi
   222â†’        done <<< "$neighbor_ids"
   223â†’
   224â†’        if [[ ${#results[@]} -gt 0 ]]; then
   225â†’            printf '%s\n' "${results[@]}" | jq -s '.'
   226â†’            return 0
   227â†’        fi
   228â†’    fi
   229â†’
   230â†’    # Fall back to related_decisions field from journal records
   231â†’    local related_ids
   232â†’    related_ids=$(echo "$decision" | jq -r '.related_decisions[]?')
   233â†’
   234â†’    if [[ -z "$related_ids" ]]; then
   235â†’        echo "[]"
   236â†’        return
   237â†’    fi
   238â†’
   239â†’    local results=()
   240â†’    while read -r id; do
   241â†’        [[ -n "$id" ]] && results+=("$(get_decision "$id")")
   242â†’    done <<< "$related_ids"
   243â†’
   244â†’    printf '%s\n' "${results[@]}" | jq -s '.'
   245â†’}
   246â†’
   247â†’# Auto-link decisions based on shared entities
   248â†’auto_link_by_entities() {
   249â†’    local decision_id="$1"
   250â†’
   251â†’    local decision
   252â†’    decision=$(get_decision "$decision_id" 2>/dev/null || true)
   253â†’
   254â†’    if [[ -z "$decision" ]]; then
   255â†’        return
   256â†’    fi
   257â†’
   258â†’    local entities
   259â†’    entities=$(echo "$decision" | jq -r '.entities[]?')
   260â†’
   261â†’    while read -r entity; do
   262â†’        [[ -z "$entity" ]] && continue
   263â†’
   264â†’        # Find other decisions with this entity
   265â†’        get_by_entity "$entity" | jq -r '.[].id' | while read -r other_id; do
   266â†’            if [[ "$other_id" != "$decision_id" ]]; then
   267â†’                link_decisions "$decision_id" "$other_id" "shared_entity"
   268â†’            fi
   269â†’        done
   270â†’    done <<< "$entities"
   271â†’}
   272â†’
   273â†’# Find decision chains (sequences of related decisions)
   274â†’find_decision_chains() {
   275â†’    local start_id="$1"
   276â†’    local max_depth="${2:-5}"
   277â†’
   278â†’    local visited=()
   279â†’    local chain=()
   280â†’
   281â†’    _traverse() {
   282â†’        local current="$1"
   283â†’        local depth="$2"
   284â†’
   285â†’        [[ $depth -gt $max_depth ]] && return
   286â†’
   287â†’        # Check if visited
   288â†’        for v in "${visited[@]}"; do
   289â†’            [[ "$v" == "$current" ]] && return
   290â†’        done
   291â†’
   292â†’        visited+=("$current")
   293â†’        chain+=("$current")
   294â†’
   295â†’        # Get related decisions
   296â†’        local related
   297â†’        related=$(get_decision "$current" | jq -r '.related_decisions[]?' 2>/dev/null)
   298â†’
   299â†’        while read -r next; do
   300â†’            [[ -n "$next" ]] && _traverse "$next" $((depth + 1))
   301â†’        done <<< "$related"
   302â†’    }
   303â†’
   304â†’    _traverse "$start_id" 0
   305â†’
   306â†’    # Output chain with full decision data
   307â†’    for id in "${chain[@]}"; do
   308â†’        get_decision "$id"
   309â†’    done | jq -s '.'
   310â†’}
   311â†’
   312â†’# Get decision context for a topic (combines search and relations)
   313â†’get_topic_context() {
   314â†’    local topic="$1"
   315â†’    local max_results="${2:-10}"
   316â†’
   317â†’    # Search for directly matching decisions
   318â†’    local direct_matches
   319â†’    direct_matches=$(search_decisions "$topic")
   320â†’
   321â†’    # Get related decisions for top matches
   322â†’    local all_decisions
   323â†’    all_decisions=$(echo "$direct_matches" | jq -r '.[0:3] | .[].id' | while read -r id; do
   324â†’        [[ -n "$id" ]] && get_related_decisions "$id"
   325â†’    done | jq -s 'add // []')
   326â†’
   327â†’    # Combine and deduplicate
   328â†’    echo "$direct_matches" "$all_decisions" | jq -s '
   329â†’        add | unique_by(.id) | sort_by(.timestamp) | reverse | .[0:'"$max_results"']
   330â†’    '
   331â†’}
   332â†’
   333â†’# Build a summary of the decision graph
   334â†’get_graph_summary() {
   335â†’    local decisions_data
   336â†’    decisions_data=$(jq -s 'group_by(.id) | map(.[0])' "$DECISIONS_FILE")
   337â†’
   338â†’    jq -n --slurpfile graph "$GRAPH_FILE" --argjson decisions "$decisions_data" '
   339â†’        ($graph[0]) as $g |
   340â†’        {
   341â†’            total_decisions: ($decisions | length),
   342â†’            total_edges: ($g.edges | length),
   343â†’            files_tracked: ([$g.nodes | to_entries[] | select(.value.type == "file")] | length),
   344â†’            relationship_types: (
   345â†’                $g.edges |
   346â†’                group_by(.relation) |
   347â†’                map({key: .[0].relation, count: length}) |
   348â†’                from_entries
   349â†’            ),
   350â†’            most_connected: (
   351â†’                $decisions |
   352â†’                sort_by(.related_decisions | length) |
   353â†’                reverse |
   354â†’                .[0:5] |
   355â†’                map({id: .id, decision: .decision[0:50], connections: (.related_decisions | length)})
   356â†’            )
   357â†’        }
   358â†’    '
   359â†’}
   360â†’
   361â†’# Export decision graph for visualization
   362â†’export_graph() {
   363â†’    local format="${1:-json}"
   364â†’
   365â†’    case "$format" in
   366â†’        json)
   367â†’            # Filter main graph to decision-related nodes and edges
   368â†’            jq '{
   369â†’                nodes: (.nodes | to_entries | map(select(.value.type == "decision" or .value.type == "file")) | from_entries),
   370â†’                edges: [.edges[] | select(
   371â†’                    . as $e |
   372â†’                    any(keys[]; . == "from") and
   373â†’                    any(keys[]; . == "to")
   374â†’                )]
   375â†’            }' "$GRAPH_FILE"
   376â†’            ;;
   377â†’        dot)
   378â†’            echo "digraph decisions {"
   379â†’            echo "  rankdir=LR;"
   380â†’            jq -r '.nodes | to_entries[] | "  \"\(.key)\" [label=\"\(.value.name)\"];"' "$GRAPH_FILE"
   381â†’            jq -r '.edges[] | "  \"\(.from)\" -> \"\(.to)\" [label=\"\(.relation)\"];"' "$GRAPH_FILE"
   382â†’            echo "}"
   383â†’            ;;
   384â†’        mermaid)
   385â†’            echo "graph LR"
   386â†’            jq -r '.nodes | to_entries[] | "  \(.key)[\"\(.value.name)\"]"' "$GRAPH_FILE"
   387â†’            jq -r '.edges[] | "  \(.from) -->|\(.relation)| \(.to)"' "$GRAPH_FILE"
   388â†’            ;;
   389â†’        *)
   390â†’            echo "Unknown format: $format" >&2
   391â†’            return 1
   392â†’            ;;
   393â†’    esac
   394â†’}
   395â†’

Perfect! Now I have a complete picture. Let me compile the findings:

## Summary: Data Ingestion into graph/data/graph.json

### 1. Files Handling Graph Node Creation/Updates

**Primary Node Management:**

#!/usr/bin/env bash
# Node management for Memory Graph
# Node types: concept, file, pattern, lesson, decision, session

set -euo pipefail

GRAPH_DIR="${GRAPH_DIR:-$(dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}")/..}"
GRAPH_FILE="${GRAPH_DIR}/data/graph.json"

# Ensure graph file exists
init_graph() {
    mkdir -p "$(dirname "$GRAPH_FILE")"
    if [[ ! -f "$GRAPH_FILE" ]]; then
        echo '{"nodes":{},"edges":[]}' > "$GRAPH_FILE"
    fi
}

# Generate a unique node ID
generate_node_id() {
    local name="$1"
    local type="$2"
    # Create deterministic ID from type and name for deduplication
    echo "${type}-$(echo -n "${name}" | md5sum | cut -c1-8)"
}

# Valid node types
VALID_NODE_TYPES=("concept" "file" "pattern" "lesson" "decision" "session" "project")

validate_node_type() {
    local type="$1"
    for valid in "${VALID_NODE_TYPES[@]}"; do
        if [[ "$type" == "$valid" ]]; then
            return 0
        fi
    done
    return 1
}

# Add a node to the graph
# Usage: add_node <type> <name> [data_json]
add_node() {
    local type="$1"
    local name="$2"
    local data="${3:-"{}"}"

    if ! validate_node_type "$type"; then
        echo "Error: Invalid node type '$type'. Valid types: ${VALID_NODE_TYPES[*]}" >&2
        return 1
    fi

    init_graph

    local id
    id=$(generate_node_id "$name" "$type")
    local timestamp
    timestamp=$(date -u +"%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%SZ")

    # Check if node exists for merging
    local existing
    existing=$(jq -r --arg id "$id" '.nodes[$id] // empty' "$GRAPH_FILE")

    if [[ -n "$existing" ]]; then
        # Merge: update data and updated_at, preserve created_at
        jq --arg id "$id" \
           --arg name "$name" \
           --argjson new_data "$data" \
           --arg updated "$timestamp" \
           '.nodes[$id].data = (.nodes[$id].data * $new_data) | .nodes[$id].name = $name | .nodes[$id].updated_at = $updated' \
           "$GRAPH_FILE" > "${GRAPH_FILE}.tmp" && mv "${GRAPH_FILE}.tmp" "$GRAPH_FILE"

        echo "Merged node: $id"
    else
        # Create new node
        jq --arg id "$id" \
           --arg name "$name" \
           --arg type "$type" \
           --argjson data "$data" \
           --arg created "$timestamp" \
           '.nodes[$id] = {type: $type, name: $name, data: $data, created_at: $created, updated_at: $created}' \
           "$GRAPH_FILE" > "${GRAPH_FILE}.tmp" && mv "${GRAPH_FILE}.tmp" "$GRAPH_FILE"

        echo "Created node: $id"
    fi

    echo "$id"
}

# Get a node by ID
get_node() {
    local id="$1"
    init_graph
    jq -r --arg id "$id" '.nodes[$id] // empty' "$GRAPH_FILE"
}

# Get a node by name and optional type
find_node() {
    local name="$1"
    local type="${2:-}"

    init_graph

    if [[ -n "$type" ]]; then
        jq -r --arg name "$name" --arg type "$type" \
           'to_entries[] | select(.value.name == $name and .value.type == $type) | .key' \
           <<< "$(jq '.nodes' "$GRAPH_FILE")"
    else
        jq -r --arg name "$name" \
           'to_entries[] | select(.value.name == $name) | .key' \
           <<< "$(jq '.nodes' "$GRAPH_FILE")"
    fi
}

# Delete a node and its edges
delete_node() {
    local id="$1"
    init_graph

    # Remove node and all edges referencing it
    jq --arg id "$id" \
       'del(.nodes[$id]) | .edges = [.edges[] | select(.from != $id and .to != $id)]' \
       "$GRAPH_FILE" > "${GRAPH_FILE}.tmp" && mv "${GRAPH_FILE}.tmp" "$GRAPH_FILE"

    echo "Deleted node: $id"
}

# List all nodes, optionally filtered by type
list_nodes() {
    local type="${1:-}"
    init_graph

    if [[ -n "$type" ]]; then
        jq -r --arg type "$type" \
           '.nodes | to_entries[] | select(.value.type == $type) | "\(.key)\t\(.value.type)\t\(.value.name)"' \
           "$GRAPH_FILE"
    else
        jq -r '.nodes | to_entries[] | "\(.key)\t\(.value.type)\t\(.value.name)"' "$GRAPH_FILE"
    fi
}

# Update node data
update_node() {
    local id="$1"
    local data="$2"

    init_graph

    local timestamp
    timestamp=$(date -u +"%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%SZ")

    jq --arg id "$id" \
       --argjson data "$data" \
       --arg updated "$timestamp" \
       'if .nodes[$id] then .nodes[$id].data = (.nodes[$id].data * $data) | .nodes[$id].updated_at = $updated else . end' \
       "$GRAPH_FILE" > "${GRAPH_FILE}.tmp" && mv "${GRAPH_FILE}.tmp" "$GRAPH_FILE"

    echo "Updated node: $id"
}

# Get node count
node_count() {
    init_graph
    jq '.nodes | length' "$GRAPH_FILE"
}

# Export for use in other scripts
export -f init_graph generate_node_id validate_node_type add_node get_node find_node delete_node list_nodes update_node node_count

content.text: Line 62-69 is the problem. When a node exists, it unconditionally merges data and bumps `updated_at` â€” even if the incoming data is identical. The fix: compare before writing.

           "$GRAPH_FILE" > "${GRAPH_FILE}.tmp" && mv "${GRAPH_FILE}.tmp" "$GRAPH_FILE"

        echo "Merged node: $id"
